target_content: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it directly aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The target's focus on reducing emissions by a specific percentage makes it a clear fit for this sub-theme.

target_content: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030
justification: This target is also assigned to the Climate Resilience sub-theme because reducing GHG emissions is a key aspect of building climate resilience.

target_content: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Methane sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing methane emissions.

target_content: Reduce methane emissions by 35 to 37% compared to 2005 levels, by 2030
justification: This target is also assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because methane is a potent greenhouse gas, and reducing its emissions contributes to overall GHG reduction.

target_content: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2045.
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because achieving energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector implies reducing energy consumption and increasing energy efficiency.

target_content: EU ETS. The contribution of the sectors covered by the existing EU Emission trading System (EU ETS) with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce emissions from sectors covered by the EU ETS.

target_content: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically mentions reducing emissions from the buildings sector.

target_content: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
justification: This target is also assigned to the GHG Reduction - Transports sub-theme because it mentions reducing emissions from the road transport sector.

target_content: ESR. Increased national targets in line with an EU- wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce emissions across various sectors.

target_content: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector, by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Removal sub-theme because it focuses on achieving net greenhouse gas removals through land use, land use change, and forestry.

target_content: No debit rule. For the period from 2021 to 2025, each Member State shall ensure that greenhouse gas emissions from the sector do not exceed greenhouse gas removals
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it aims to balance emissions with removals, effectively reducing net emissions.

target_content: Reduce buildings’ greenhouse gas emissions by 60%, by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing greenhouse gas emissions from buildings.

target_content: REPowerEU sets a target of 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen production and 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen imports by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it specifically mentions renewable hydrogen production and imports.

target_content: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10.000 by 2025
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the setup of renewables-based energy communities.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it focuses on the use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin for hydrogen production.

target_content: Double the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to increase the deployment of heat pumps, which are energy-efficient solutions for heating.

target_content: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and almost 600 GW by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Solar sub-theme because it specifically focuses on increasing solar photovoltaic capacity.

target_content: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it mentions increasing the use of solar heat and geothermal energy for heating and cooling.

target_content: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Solar sub-theme because it specifically mentions installing PV capacity to increase the share of renewable energy.

target_content: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the overall share of energy from renewable sources.

target_content: Member States shall set an indicative target for innovative renewable energy technology of at least 5% of newly installed renewable energy capacity by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the development and installation of innovative renewable energy technologies.

target_content: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to foster cooperation among member states for the production of renewable energy.

target_content: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.

target_content: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it specifically aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector.

target_content: By 2022, achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State’s binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to achieve a specific percentage of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources.

target_content: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1.6 percentage points
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it promotes the increase of renewable sources in the industry sector.

target_content: A target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Infrastructure sub-theme because it focuses on increasing electricity interconnection among member states.

target_content: Indicative target of at least a 49% share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it specifically aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the building sector.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to reduce the total final energy consumption of public bodies.

target_content: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to reduce overall energy consumption.

target_content: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to limit primary energy consumption.

target_content: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on renovating buildings to make them nearly zero-energy.

target_content: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to reduce the final energy consumption of buildings.

target_content: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to increase the energy renovation rate of buildings.

target_content: Reduce buildings’ energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically focuses on reducing energy consumption for heating and cooling in buildings.

target_content: Member states will have to renovate 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on renovating worst-performing non-residential buildings.

target_content: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it aims to achieve a significant portion of energy use reduction through renovating worst-performing buildings.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it focuses on reducing the average primary energy use of the residential building stock.

target_content: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix.

target_content: Cumulative EU offshore goals of installed capacity: 60 GW by 2030 and 300 GW by 2050
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Ocean/Offshore sub-theme because it specifically focuses on increasing offshore installed capacity.

target_content: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Ocean/Offshore sub-theme because it aims to increase the installed capacity of ocean energy.

target_content: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Hydrogen sub-theme because it mentions the use of renewable hydrogen for decarbonizing steel production.

target_content: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste by 2030
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste sub-theme because it specifically aims to reduce residual municipal waste.

target_content: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it aims to increase the circular material use rate.

target_content: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able of extracting the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the Union's extraction capacity for strategic raw materials.

target_content: By 2030, Union processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, should be able of producing at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it aims to increase the Union's processing capacity for strategic raw materials.

target_content: Diversify the Union’s imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensuring that, by 2030, the Union’s annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import sub-theme because it aims to diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials.

target_content: By 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Net-Zero Technology - Manufacturing sub-theme because it focuses on increasing the manufacturing capacity of strategic net-zero technologies.

target_content: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able of producing at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it aims to increase the Union's recycling capacity for strategic raw materials.

target_content: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries, industrial batteries and electric vehicle batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall take back, free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it focuses on the take-back and recycling of batteries.

target_content: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets collection targets for waste portable batteries.

target_content: Producers of LMT batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets collection targets for waste LMT batteries.

target_content: For industrial batteries with a capacity greater than 2kWh, except those with exclusively external storage, electric vehicle batteries and starting, lighting and ignition batteries that contain cobalt, lead, lithium or nickel in active materials, the minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant shall be
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it sets minimum recycled content percentages for industrial batteries.

target_content: Any natural or legal person that places on the market products incorporating portable batteries shall ensure that those batteries are readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime of the product
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it aims to ensure that portable batteries are removable and replaceable.

target_content: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for recycling efficiency.

target_content: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for recycling efficiency of lithium-based batteries.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for the recovery of materials.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027, and 80% for lithium no later than 31 December 2031
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling sub-theme because it sets targets for the recovery of lithium.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Food Waste sub-theme because it specifically aims to reduce food waste in processing and manufacturing.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Food Waste sub-theme because it aims to reduce food waste across various sectors.

target_content: All packaging shall be recyclable
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging sub-theme because it aims to make all packaging recyclable.

target_content: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging sub-theme because it sets minimum percentages of recycled content in packaging.

target_content: Achieve an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the Biofuels sub-theme because it specifically mentions the production of sustainable biomethane.

target_content: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory. A sustained reduction is achieved if the annual consumption does not exceed 40 lightweight plastic carrier bags per person, or the equivalent target in weight, by 31 December 2025, and subsequently by 31 December in each year thereafter. Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging" because it aims to reduce the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags, which is a type of plastic packaging waste. The target is specific to reducing plastic waste, making this sub-theme the most relevant.

target_content: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory. A sustained reduction is achieved if the annual consumption does not exceed 40 lightweight plastic carrier bags per person, or the equivalent target in weight, by 31 December 2025, and subsequently by 31 December in each year thereafter. Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging" because reducing plastic carrier bag consumption can lead to increased recycling and circularity of plastic packaging materials.

target_content: Each Member State shall reduce the packaging waste generated per capita, as compared to the packaging waste generated per capita in 2018 as reported to the Commission in accordance with Decision 2005/270/EC by 5% by 2030, 10% by 2035, 15% by 2040 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste" because it aims to reduce packaging waste generated per capita, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Each Member State shall reduce the packaging waste generated per capita, as compared to the packaging waste generated per capita in 2018 as reported to the Commission in accordance with Decision 2005/270/EC by 5% by 2030, 10% by 2035, 15% by 2040 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because reducing packaging waste can lead to increased recycling and circularity of municipal waste materials.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025, and of 70% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2030. Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of plastic by weight of plastic contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025, and of 55% by weight of plastic in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2030. Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging" because it sets specific recycling targets for plastic packaging waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 25% of wood by weight of wood contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 30% by 31 December 2030. Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for wood packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of ferrous metals by weight of ferrous metals contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 80% by 31 December 2030 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for ferrous metals packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of aluminium by weight of aluminium contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 60% by 31 December 2030 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for aluminium packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 75% by 31 December 2030 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for glass packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 75% of paper and cardboard by weight of paper and cardboard contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025 and of 85% by 31 December 2030 Proposal on packaging and packaging waste
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste" because it sets specific recycling targets for paper and cardboard packaging waste, which is a type of municipal waste.

target_content: Each vehicle belonging to a vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of this Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall be constructed so that it is: (a) reusable/recyclable to a minimum of 85% by mass, (b) reusable/recoverable to a minimum of 95 % by mass. Proposal for a Regulation on circularity requirements for vehicle design and on management of end-of-life vehicles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Vehicle Circularity" because it sets specific requirements for vehicle design and end-of-life management, aiming to increase recyclability and reusability of vehicles.

target_content: The plastic contained in each vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of the Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall contain a minimum of 25 % of plastic recycled by weight from post-consumer plastic waste. Proposal for a Regulation on circularity requirements for vehicle design and on management of end-of-life vehicles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging" because it sets a specific requirement for the use of recycled plastic in vehicle production, aiming to increase circularity of plastic materials.

target_content: At least 25% of the target set out in the first subparagraph shall be achieved by including plastics recycled from end-of-life vehicles in the vehicle type concerned. Proposal for a Regulation on circularity requirements for vehicle design and on management of end-of-life vehicles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Vehicle Circularity" because it sets a specific requirement for the use of recycled plastics from end-of-life vehicles in new vehicle production, aiming to increase circularity of vehicle materials.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that the following targets are met by the waste management operators: (a) the reuse and recovery, as calculated together, shall be a minimum of 95 %, by average weight per vehicle, excluding batteries, and year, (b) the reuse and recycling, as calculated together, shall be a minimum of 85 %, by average weight per vehicle, excluding batteries, and year. Proposal for a Regulation on circularity requirements for vehicle design and on management of end-of-life vehicles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Vehicle Circularity" because it sets specific targets for reuse, recovery, and recycling of vehicle materials, aiming to increase circularity of vehicle waste.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that waste management operators achieve a yearly target for the recycling of plastics of at least 30 % of the total weight of plastics contained in the vehicles delivered to the waste management operators. Proposal for a Regulation on circularity requirements for vehicle design and on management of end-of-life vehicles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging" because it sets a specific target for the recycling of plastics from vehicles, aiming to increase circularity of plastic materials.

target_content: At least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources by 2030, in full consideration of the EU's biodiversity and circular economy objectives and of the upcoming policy framework for bio-based, biodegradable and compostable plastics. Communication on Sustainable Carbon Cycles
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging" because it sets a specific target for the use of sustainable non-fossil carbon sources in chemical and plastic products, aiming to increase circularity of plastic materials.

target_content: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced, compared to the reference value (91.16 gCO2e/MJ) by: 2% from 1 January 2025, 6% from 1 January 2030, 14.5% from 1 January 2035, 31% from 1 January 2040, 62% from 1 January 2045, 80% from 1 January 2050. Regulation (EU) 2023/1805
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "GHG Reduction - Transports" because it sets specific targets for reducing GHG intensity of energy used on board ships, aiming to decrease transport-related emissions.

target_content: Aviation fuel suppliers shall also ensure that Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025, 6% from 2030, 20% from 2035, 34% from 2040, 42% from 2045 and 70% from 2050. Regulation (EU) 2023/2405
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biofuels" because it sets specific targets for the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) in aviation, aiming to increase the share of biofuels in transport.

target_content: Of the SAF targets reported above, synthetic aviation fuels should represent a minimum share of 1.2% from 2030, 5% from 2035, 10% from 2034, 15% from 2045, and 35% from 2050. Regulation (EU) 2023/2405
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Other Low-Carbon Fuels" because it sets specific targets for the use of synthetic aviation fuels, which are a type of low-carbon fuel.

target_content: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1% in 2025 and 5.5% in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030. Directive (EU) 2023/2413
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biofuels" because it sets specific targets for the use of advanced biofuels and biogas in transport, aiming to increase the share of biofuels in the energy mix.

target_content: Member States with maritime ports shall endeavour to ensure that as of 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin (RFNBOs) in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1.2%. Directive (EU) 2023/2413
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Other Low-Carbon Fuels" because it sets a specific target for the use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in maritime transport, aiming to increase the share of low-carbon fuels in the energy mix.

target_content: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990. Sustainable and Smart Mobility Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "GHG Reduction - Transports" because it sets a specific target for reducing emissions from the transport sector, aiming to decrease transport-related emissions.

target_content: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030. Energy Transition of the EU Fisheries and Aquaculture sector
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it encourages reducing fuel intensity in EU fisheries, aiming to decrease energy consumption and increase energy efficiency.

target_content: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years Proposal for a Directive to support framework for intermodal transport of goods
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Transport Logistics" because it aims to reduce the cost of combined transport operations, which can lead to increased efficiency and competitiveness in the transport sector.

target_content: For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% (in the reporting period 2030-2034) and 100% (as from 2035) minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles Regulation (EU) 2024/1610
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Net-Zero Technology - Road Vehicles" because it sets specific targets for the adoption of low-emission vehicles in urban bus fleets, aiming to decrease emissions from road transport.

target_content: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles [...], off-road vehicles and off-road special purpose vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019: (a) 15% for vehicle sub-groups 4-UD, 4-RD, 4-LH, 5-RD, 5-LH, 9-RD, 9-LH, 10-RD and 10-LH for the reporting periods of the years 2025 to 2029, (b) 45% for all vehicle sub-groups other than vocational vehicles for the reporting periods of the years 2030 to 2034, (c) 65% for all vehicle sub-groups for the reporting periods of the years 2035 to 2039, (d) 90% for all vehicle sub-groups for the reporting periods of the year 2040 onwards Regulation (EU) 2024/1610
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "GHG Reduction - Transports" because it sets specific targets for reducing CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles, aiming to decrease transport-related emissions.

target_content: The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall, except in Cyprus and Malta, be limited to 1.7%. Directive (EU) 2023/2413
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biofuels" because it sets a specific limit for the use of biofuels and biogas produced from certain feedstocks in the transport sector, aiming to ensure sustainable biofuel production.

target_content: The yearly quantity of aviation fuel uplifted by a given aircraft operator at a given Union airport shall be at least 90% of the yearly aviation fuel required, to avoid tankering practices which would bring additional emissions from extra weight. Regulation (EU) 2023/2405
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce unnecessary fuel consumption in aviation by minimizing tankering practices, which can lead to increased energy efficiency.

target_content: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU. In the second phase, from 2025 up to 2030, the strategic objective is to install at least 40 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers. A Hydrogen Strategy for a climate-neutral Europe
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy - Hydrogen" because it sets specific objectives for the installation of renewable hydrogen electrolysers, aiming to increase the production of renewable hydrogen.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 1.3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations, and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 0.80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Infrastructure" because it sets specific targets for the provision of power output through publicly accessible recharging stations for electric and hybrid vehicles, aiming to support the adoption of low-emission vehicles.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Infrastructure" because it sets specific requirements for the deployment of publicly accessible recharging pools for light-duty vehicles along the TEN-T network, aiming to support the adoption of low-emission vehicles.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets), along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them [...]. Along the TEN-T comprehensive road network, recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 100 km between them and each recharging pool offers a power output of at least 1.500 kW and includes at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 350 kW. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Infrastructure" because it sets specific requirements for the deployment of publicly accessible recharging pools for heavy-duty electric vehicles along the TEN-T network, aiming to support the adoption of low-emission vehicles.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Infrastructure" because it sets a specific requirement for the deployment of publicly accessible recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles in safe and secure parking areas, aiming to support the adoption of low-emission vehicles.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed, provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW. Regulation (EU) 2023/180
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Infrastructure" because it sets a specific requirement for the deployment of publicly accessible recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles in urban nodes, aiming to support the adoption of low-emission vehicles.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy - Hydrogen" because it sets a specific requirement for the deployment of publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations in urban nodes, aiming to support the adoption of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations with a total capacity of at least 1 tonne per day, and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser, are deployed at least every 200 km along the TEN-T (Trans-European Transport Network) core network Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy - Hydrogen" because it sets a specific requirement for the deployment of publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations along the TEN-T core network, aiming to support the adoption of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles.

target_content: States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029, at all aircraft remote stands used for commercial air transport operations to embark or disembark passengers or to load or unload goods Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce energy consumption in aviation by providing electricity supply to stationary aircraft, which can lead to increased energy efficiency.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T comprehensive inland waterway ports by 1 January 2030. Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce energy consumption in inland waterway transport by providing shore-side electricity supply to vessels, which can lead to increased energy efficiency.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports. To that end, by 31 December 2029 TEN-T core and comprehensive maritime ports [...] are equipped to provide each year shore-side electricity supply for at least 90 % of the total number of port calls of seagoing container ships above 5.000 gross tonnes that are moored at the quayside at the maritime port concerned and 90% of the total number of port calls of seagoing ro-ro passenger ships above 5.000 gross tonnes and seagoing high-speed passenger craft above 5.000 gross tonnes that are moored at the quayside at the maritime port concerned Regulation (EU) 2023/1804
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce energy consumption in maritime transport by providing shore-side electricity supply to seagoing vessels, which can lead to increased energy efficiency.

target_content: Zero-emission in urban logistics The new EU Urban Mobility Framework.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Urban Mobility" because it aims to achieve zero-emission urban logistics, which can lead to increased sustainability and reduced emissions in urban areas.

target_content: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Animal Welfare" because it aims to reduce the use of antimicrobials in animal farming, which can lead to improved animal welfare and reduced antibiotic resistance.

target_content: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it aims to reduce nutrient losses and maintain soil fertility, which can lead to improved soil health and reduced environmental pollution.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides Target in Common with Biodiversity Strategy (see Thematic Area 6) and Zero Pollution Action Plan (see Thematic Area 7)
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pesticides Reduction" because it aims to reduce the use of hazardous pesticides, which can lead to improved environmental and human health.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides Target in Common with Biodiversity Strategy (see Thematic Area 6) and Zero Pollution Action Plan (see Thematic Area 7)
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pesticides Reduction" because it aims to reduce the use and risk of chemical pesticides, which can lead to improved environmental and human health.

target_content: Aquatic living resources: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture. Bring fish stocks to sustainable levels. Significant increase in organic aquaculture
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality" because it aims to increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture practices, which can lead to improved food quality and reduced environmental impact.

target_content: Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 and to the achievement of the objective for a climate-neutral Union in 2050.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "GHG Reduction" because it aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture, fisheries, and aquaculture, which can lead to improved climate change mitigation.

target_content: Water: Preserving freshwater, boosting water reuse in agriculture.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it aims to preserve freshwater and boost water reuse in agriculture, which can lead to improved water quality and reduced water pollution.

target_content: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030 Target in Common with Biodiversity Strategy (see Thematic Area 6)
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality" because it aims to increase organic farming practices, which can lead to improved food quality and reduced environmental impact.

target_content: Energy: Increase renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector. Adopt energy efficiency solutions in the agriculture and food sector, by reducing energy consumption.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the use of renewable energy in agriculture and reduce energy consumption, which can lead to improved energy efficiency and reduced greenhouse gas emissions.

target_content: Biodiversity conservation and restoration of natural resources: Protect the environment and restore natural resources. Preserve biodiversity and reduce biodiversity loss.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity conservation" because it aims to protect the environment, restore natural resources, and preserve biodiversity, which can lead to improved ecosystem health and reduced biodiversity loss.

target_content: Genetic biodiversity of food production systems: Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality" because it aims to secure access to quality seeds for plant varieties, which can lead to improved food quality and reduced vulnerability to climate change.

target_content: Reduce food waste. Prevent food loss and waste. Halve per capita food waste at retail and consumer levels* *See also Directive (EU) 2018/851 on waste with a target on food waste reduction of 30% by 2025
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Reduction - Food Waste" because it aims to reduce food waste and prevent food loss, which can lead to improved food security and reduced environmental impact.

target_content: Circular economy: Scale-up and promote sustainable and socially responsible production methods and circular business models in food processing and retail.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Circularity/Recycling" because it aims to promote sustainable and circular production methods and business models in food processing and retail, which can lead to improved resource efficiency and reduced waste.

target_content: Consumption footprint: Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, operating within planetary boundaries. Reduce the EU’s contribution to global deforestation and forest degradation.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality" because it aims to reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, which can lead to improved food quality and reduced environmental impact.

target_content: Income distribution: Ensure fair income and salaries. Improve income of primary producers to ensure their sustainable livelihood.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Social Security - Workers Protection" because it aims to ensure fair income and salaries for primary producers, which can lead to improved social security and reduced poverty.

target_content: Sectorial growth: Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Competitive Agriculture" because it aims to help farmers and fishers strengthen their position in the supply chain and capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production, which can lead to improved competitiveness and reduced poverty.

target_content: Market power and business structure: Improve agricultural rules that strengthen the position of farmers (e.g. producers of products with geographical indications), their cooperatives and producer organisations in the food supply chain.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Competitive Agriculture" because it aims to improve agricultural rules that strengthen the position of farmers and their cooperatives in the food supply chain, which can lead to improved competitiveness and reduced poverty.

target_content: Price: Preserve the price affordability of food.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food affordability" because it aims to preserve the price affordability of food, which can lead to improved food security and reduced poverty.

target_content: Trade: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Competitive Agriculture" because it aims to foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector, which can lead to improved trade and reduced poverty.

target_content: Digitalisation and knowledge transfer. Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas to achieve the objective of 100% access by 2025 (enabler for jobs, businesses, investments, improvement in quality of life in rural areas and enabler to mainstream precision farming and use of artificial intelligence
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Digitalisation" because it aims to ensure access to fast broadband in rural areas, which can lead to improved digitalisation and reduced poverty.

target_content: Transport, accessibility and infrastructure: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Transport Logistics" because it aims to create shorter supply chains and reduce dependence on long-haul transportation, which can lead to improved logistics and reduced environmental impact.

target_content: Employment and working conditions: Create new job opportunities. Improve working conditions, ensure occupation health and safety.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Social Security - Workers Protection" because it aims to create new job opportunities and improve working conditions, which can lead to improved social security and reduced poverty.

target_content: Social protection and poverty: Ensure fair, inclusive and ethical value chains. Ensure workers’ social protection and housing conditions, promote socially responsible production methods, Mitigate the socio- economic consequences impacting the food chain and ensure that the key principles enshrined in the European Pillar of Social Rights are respected, especially when it comes to precarious, seasonal and undeclared workers.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Social Security - Workers Protection" because it focuses on ensuring fair and inclusive value chains, protecting workers' social rights, and promoting socially responsible production methods.

target_content: Animal welfare: Promote better animal welfare to improve animal health and food quality.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Animal Welfare" because it aims to promote better animal welfare, which is directly related to food quality.

target_content: Food messaging: Provide food information and labelling to empower consumers to make informed, healthy and sustainable food choices. Strengthen educational messages on the importance of healthy nutrition, sustainable food production and consumption, and reducing food waste
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Healthy Food" because it focuses on providing food information and labelling to promote healthy and sustainable food choices.

target_content: Food availability: Improve availability of sustainable food. Ensure that the healthy option is always the easiest one. Ensure food supply.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food affordability" because it aims to improve the availability of sustainable food and ensure that healthy options are easily accessible.

target_content: Food affordability: Ensure affordability to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food affordability" because it directly focuses on ensuring that food is affordable and sustainable.

target_content: Properties of food: Increase reformulation of food products in line with guidelines for healthy and sustainable diets
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Healthy Food" because it aims to reformulate food products to make them healthier and more sustainable.

target_content: Food security: Ensuring food security and access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food for all.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food affordability" because it focuses on ensuring access to quality and nutritious food for all.

target_content: Nutrition and healthy, sustainable diets: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Healthy Food" because it aims to promote healthier and more sustainable diets.

target_content: Health impact of diets: Reversing of the rise in overweight and obesity rates across the EU by 2030
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food quality - Healthy Food" because it focuses on reversing the rise in overweight and obesity rates, which is related to healthy diets.

target_content: Preparedness, shock resilience, adaptation and transformation: Strengthen the resilience of the EU food system. Build up resilience to climate change, possible future diseases and pandemics. Increasing the sustainability of food producers will ultimately increase their resilience.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Competitive Agriculture" because it aims to strengthen the resilience of the EU food system and increase the sustainability of food producers.

target_content: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU’s land area
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it focuses on legally protecting a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: 1.b Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Fisheries" because it focuses on protecting the EU's sea area, which is related to fisheries and marine biodiversity.

target_content: 2.a Strictly protect at least a third of the EU'S protected areas
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it aims to strictly protect at least a third of the EU's protected areas, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: 2b. Strictly protect all remaining EU primary and old- growth forests
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests" because it focuses on strictly protecting the EU's primary and old-growth forests, which is related to forest ecosystem restoration.

target_content: 4. By 2030, significant areas of degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems are restored. Habitats and species show no deterioration in conservation trends and status, and at least 30% reach favourable conservation status or at least show a positive trend.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration" because it aims to restore degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems, which is directly related to ecosystem restoration.

target_content: 5. The decline of pollinators is reversed
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it focuses on reversing the decline of pollinators, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: 6. The risk and use of chemical pesticides is reduced by 50%, and the use of more hazardous pesticides is reduced by 50%
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pesticides Reduction" because it aims to reduce the risk and use of chemical pesticides, which is directly related to pesticide reduction.

target_content: 7. At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Agricultural Ecosystems" because it focuses on increasing the area of high-diversity landscape features in agriculture, which is related to agricultural ecosystem restoration.

target_content: 9. Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests" because it aims to plant three billion trees in the EU, which is directly related to forest ecosystem restoration.

target_content: 11. At least 25.000 km of free-flowing rivers are restored
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Rivers" because it focuses on restoring free-flowing rivers, which is directly related to river ecosystem restoration.

target_content: 12. There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by Invasive Alien Species (IAS)
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it aims to reduce the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: 13. The losses of nutrients from fertilisers are reduced by 50%, resulting in the reduction of the use of fertilisers by at least 20%
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it focuses on reducing nutrient losses from fertilizers, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: 14. Cities with at least 20.000 inhabitants have an ambitious Urban Greening Plan
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Urban Nature" because it aims to promote urban greening plans in cities, which is related to urban nature and biodiversity conservation.

target_content: In accordance with the CFP, it is crucial to continue and accelerate the work of rebuilding and keeping fish stocks above MSY levels
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Fisheries" because it focuses on rebuilding and keeping fish stocks above MSY levels, which is directly related to fisheries and marine biodiversity.

target_content: Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration" because it aims to restore terrestrial ecosystems, which is directly related to ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of sea areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Ecosystem Restoration" because it focuses on restoring marine ecosystems, which is directly related to marine ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration" because it aims to restore terrestrial, coastal, and freshwater ecosystems, which is directly related to ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration" because it focuses on re-establishing habitat types in areas not covered by those habitat types, which is directly related to ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures for the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species listed in Annexes II, IV and V
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it aims to restore habitats for species listed in Annexes II, IV, and V, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall ensure that condition is known for at least 90% of the area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030 and 100% by 2040.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Monitoring" because it focuses on monitoring the condition of habitat types, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation monitoring.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration" because it aims to increase the area of habitats in good condition, which is directly related to ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (urban ecosystems) By 2030, Member States shall ensure that there is no net loss in the total national area of urban green space, and of urban tree canopy cover in urban ecosystem areas.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Urban Nature" because it focuses on maintaining urban green space and tree canopy cover, which is related to urban nature and biodiversity conservation.

target_content: (urban ecosystems) Member States shall achieve thereafter an increasing trend in the total national area of urban green space, including through the integration of urban green space into buildings and infrastructure
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Urban Nature" because it aims to increase the area of urban green space, which is directly related to urban nature and biodiversity conservation.

target_content: (urban ecosystems) Member States shall achieve, in each urban ecosystem area, determined in accordance with Article 14(4), an increasing trend of urban tree canopy cover
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Urban Nature" because it focuses on increasing urban tree canopy cover, which is directly related to urban nature and biodiversity conservation.

target_content: Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Rivers" because it aims to restore natural connectivity of rivers and remove artificial barriers, which is directly related to river ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (pollinator) Member States shall, by putting in place in a timely manner appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation" because it focuses on improving pollinator diversity and reversing the decline of pollinator populations, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve [...] areas of habitat types listed in Annex II which are not in good condition.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Ecosystem Restoration" because it aims to restore marine ecosystems, which is directly related to marine ecosystem restoration.

target_content: ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types of groups 1-6 listed in Annex II
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Ecosystem Restoration" because it focuses on re-establishing habitat types in marine ecosystems, which is directly related to marine ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1–6 of Annex II.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection & Conservation - Monitoring" because it aims to monitor the condition of marine habitat types, which is directly related to biodiversity conservation monitoring.

target_content: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least two out of the three following indicators in agricultural ecosystems
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Agricultural Ecosystems" because it focuses on improving indicators in agricultural ecosystems, which is directly related to agricultural ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place restoration measures which shall aim to ensure that the common farmland bird index at national level based on the species specified in Annex V reaches the following levels
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Agricultural Ecosystems" because it aims to restore farmland bird populations, which is directly related to agricultural ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to restore organic soils in agricultural use constituting drained peatlands.
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it focuses on restoring organic soils in agricultural use, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: (trees) When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests" because it aims to plant additional trees, which is directly related to forest ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least six out of seven of the following indicators in forest ecosystems
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests" because it focuses on improving indicators in forest ecosystems, which is directly related to forest ecosystem restoration.

target_content: (forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests" because it aims to restore forest bird populations, which is directly related to forest ecosystem restoration.

target_content: Reach no net land take
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it focuses on reaching no net land take, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it aims to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean, which is directly related to water quality.

target_content: The Ambient Air Quality Directives set EU air quality standards for 12 air pollutants
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Air Quality" because it focuses on setting EU air quality standards, which is directly related to air quality improvement.

target_content: The Water Reuse Regulation aim to encourage and facilitate water reuse in the EU
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it aims to encourage and facilitate water reuse, which is directly related to water quality improvement.

target_content: The Industrial Emissions Directive (IED) aims at preventing or reducing emissions from large industrial installations and intensive farming into the environment.
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Air Quality" because it focuses on preventing or reducing emissions from industrial installations and intensive farming, which is directly related to air quality improvement.

target_content: The revised Urban Wastewater Treatment Directive (UWWTD) extends the scope of the 1991 UWWTD
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it aims to improve urban wastewater treatment, which is directly related to water quality improvement.

target_content: Improve soil quality by reducing chemical pesticides’ use by 50%, by 2030
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it focuses on reducing chemical pesticides' use, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses use by 50%, by 2030
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it aims to reduce nutrient losses, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Air Quality" because it focuses on reducing premature deaths caused by air pollution, which is directly related to air quality improvement.

target_content: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%)
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it aims to reduce waste and plastic litter at sea, which is directly related to water quality improvement.

target_content: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it focuses on reducing microplastics released into the environment, which is directly related to water quality improvement.

target_content: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, by 2030
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Air Quality" because it aims to reduce the number of EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, which is directly related to air quality improvement.

target_content: Reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise by 30%, by 2030
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Noise Reduction" because it focuses on reducing the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise, which is directly related to noise reduction.

target_content: Having all soils in healthy condition by 2050
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Soils Health" because it aims to have all soils in healthy condition, which is directly related to soil health.

target_content: By means of an updated and harmonised list of pollutants affecting surface and groundwater, updated existing quality standards, new monitoring requirements, improved and more accessible data, and a more flexible framework for addressing pollutants of emerging concerns
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improve Water Quality" because it focuses on updating and harmonizing the list of pollutants affecting surface and groundwater, which is directly related to water quality improvement.
